profiledesc.creation: Guide created by Susan Stessin-Cohn and Lucia O'Corozine

did.abstract: Slides, albums, loose pictures--color and b&w (some oversized), newsletters, Books of Evidence, annual reports and minutes, book lists, correspondences, Yearbooks, newspaper clippings, civic beautification records, Christmas programs, flower shows,

bioghist.head: Organizational Sketch
bioghist.p: The New Paltz Garden Club was formed in 1946 as an offshoot of the New Paltz Study Club. It is a 501c3 non-profit organization dedicated to beautifying our community, sharing knowledge, plants, and friendship since 1946. Their yearly calendar includes programs such as lectures, trips, demonstrations, workshops, flower shows, plant swap, garden tours and Table Carousel. Active members maintain three public gardens throughout New Paltz, NY and flower tubs at the NY State Thruway.

accessrestrict.p: Non-circulating collection. Onsite access is unrestricted.
